result.title: Policy paper on how to adapt EU funds
result.description: This paper examines options for how we could modify Structural Funds and similar EU financial resources to make them better suited to medium-term ex post shock mitigation. These instruments are currently regulated and managed at the EU level in a way that is unrelated to fiscal coordination and disregarding the potential for emergency situations.

result.title: Working paper on fiscal capacity
result.description: This paper studies the scope for a central EMU budget, taking into account the welfare effects of central government transfers following adverse shocks. It uses an open-economy discrete-time New Keynesian model with a continuum of countries.

result.title: Working paper that uses stochastic simulations of the fiscal outcomes
result.description: Despite methodological improvements, uncertainty over the output gap will undoubtedly remain large. This paper uses a simulation model to analyse how the uncertainty affects optimal policy, and how the current minimum requirements comply with our findings.

result.title: DAP implemented for Copernicus Global Land Service
result.description: This deliverable provide: A version of a popular distributed Data Access Protocol – abbreviated to DAP – customized to handle more gridded data holdings in their native file-formats so as not to create unnecessary overhead with the existing Copernicus service providers (e.g. file-format conversions), mapping their unique data holdings into a common 5D data model (x, y, z, time, and forecast time).

result.title: New tools for handling linked EO data and their evaluation – v1
result.description: The tools to be developed include publishing tools that take as input EO data coming from the Copernicus services and transform it into RDF, tools for interlinking EO data and related geospatial data, tools for querying EO data published as RDF graphs, and tools for visualizing linked EO data. All tools will be available as open source.

result.title: Tools to enhance, catalogue, and consume geospatial data-streams from Copernicus
result.description: The SDL will be extended with Semantic Web standards providing a framework for explicitly describing the data models implicit in EO and other gridded data streams to enhance downstream display and manipulation of data. This also provides a framework where multiple metadata standards can be described. Most importantly, these data models and metadata standards can be interrelated, a key step in creating interoperability, and an important step in being able to ‘re-map’ various metadata formats in compliance with the standards as put forward by the INPIRE Spatial Data Services Working Group.

result.title: Research paper on the impacts of different constellations of monetary and policy mix in the Euro Area following the global financial crisis
result.description: This paper studies the interaction between monetary and fiscal policies both empirically and using NIGEM. It investigates what constellation of the monetary and fiscal policies are optimal from the perspective of different needs of countries comprising the single currency block. It takes into account various monetary and fiscal policy restrictions (zero-bound and debt levels).
